news.title: Minister Mhona commissions Hokonya Traffic Training Centre
news.content:
Victor Maphosa in Chivhu

Traffic and Infrastructural Development Minister Felix Mhona has officially commissioned the Hokonya Traffic Training Centre at Hokonya Primary School in Chivhu, Chikomba district.

The centre was established by the Traffic Safety Council of Zimbabwe (TSCZ) as a platform to educate pupils on what they are expected to and not to do on the roads.

Minister Mhona said the centre was established to primarily reduce road carnage.

As you know, the Traffic Safety Council of Zimbabwe was established for the purpose of promoting road safety in the country, he said.

Today, we are here to witness an innovative way of promoting road safety through a Traffic Training Centre.

This training centre has become a central watershed for the promotion of road safety in this part of the country.

He said it is also a train-the-trainers centre where teachers, students and members of the public can benefit from and subsequently use that knowledge to influence others in their spheres of influence.

Indeed, our stated position is that road safety is everyones business, and the road safety message must reach every corner of Zimbabwe for us to win the war against carnage, he said.

In his remarks during the official opening, TSCZ board chairman Mr Kura Sibanda said the centre is intended to benefit all students in Chivhu.

While the training centre will largely benefit Hokonya Primary School students, the intention is for it to benefit other students from surrounding schools and all the children in the Chivhu community, he said.

The construction of this centre is indeed a significant milestone towards achieving the United Nations goal of reducing road carnage.

news.title: Zanu PF Women’s League backs President Mnangagwa’s vision for 2030
news.content:
Mutsawashe Mashandure

Herald Correspondent

The ruling party, Zanu PF Womens League, is rallying behind the resolution to extend President Mnangagwas tenure to 2030.

Despite his refusal to seek another term, the league wants him to complete his transformative development project of achieving an upper-middle-income economy by 2030.

Zanu PFs Secretary for Womens Affairs, Cde Mabel Chinomona told a meeting organised by the league with female ministers and deputy ministers that it was crucial for women to

support the Presidents Vision 2030 so that they see the fruits for themselves.

You are party appointees, honourable ministers, hence we expect you to be responsive to our party, she said.

I was happy that every province has its number one resolution that the sitting President will be there until 2030. So the President will be able to accomplish his goal, and the people will see the vision.

She urged the ministers and deputy ministers to use their positions to advance the interests and well-being of women.

We know that you are very busy, and we appreciate the sacrifice you have made to be here with us today, she said.

This shows your dedication to our party. We are all here because we share a common goal, that of advancing the interests and well-being of women through your respective ministries.

news.title: President arrives in Tanzania
news.content:
Fungi Kwaramba in Dar es Salaam

President Mnangagwa has arrived in Tanzania for the joint Sadc and EAC Summit that is expected to thrash out a peaceful resolution to the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) crisis where the government is fighting rebels in the eastern part of the country.

The President, who will join other African Heads of State and Government tomorrow for the joint Sadc-EAC Summit, was welcomed at the Julius Nyerere International Airport byMiss Lela Muhamed Mussa, Minister for Education, the revolutionary Government of Zanzibar and Zimbabwes Ambassador to Tanzania Helen Dingani.

Earlier today, Foreign Affairs Ministers from Sadc and the EAC attended precursor meetings to the joint summit.

As the Sadc Chairperson, President Mnangagwa will co-chair the joint conference with his EAC counterpart President William Ruto of Kenya.

Democratic Republic of Congo President Felix Tshisekedi and Rwandan President Paul Kagame are also expected to attend the summit as the main protagonists in the three-decade-long conflict that has lately threatened to ignite a regional war in the Great Lakes region.

DRC accuses Rwanda of sponsoring marauding rebel groups in its rich eastern region, charges which Kigali stridently refutes.

news.title: Veteran liberation war hero Cde Tinaye Chigudu declared national hero
news.content:
Ivan Zhakata

Herald Correspondent

President Mnangagwa has mourned the passing of veteran liberation fighter and former Manicaland Governor, Cde Tinaye Elisha Nzirasha Chigudu, describing him as a principled cadre whose dedication to Zimbabwes independence and governance was unwavering.

In a statement following Cde Chigudus passing, President Mnangagwa expressed deep sorrow, highlighting the late heros role in the liberation struggle and his service to both the ruling Zanu PF party and the Government.

I received with deep sorrow and sadness, news of the untimely death of Cde Tinaye Elisha Nzirasha Chigudu, a veteran of our liberation struggle, President Mnangagwa said.

He was among the brave sons and daughters of the soil who took a stand and fought for the Independence of Zimbabwe.

Cde Chigudu was among the earliest combatants trained under the Zimbabwe Peoples Revolutionary Army (ZPRA) in North Korea.

His intelligence operations in Salisbury (now Harare) provided crucial insights into Rhodesian military tactics, aiding the guerrilla warfare efforts.

His capture and subsequent 12-year imprisonment by the colonial regime did not deter his commitmentupon release, he resumed his fight for liberation.

President Mnangagwa acknowledged Cde Chigudus post-independence contributions, particularly in the Government and the ruling party.

He was a fountain of wisdom who offered wise counsel and advice in conducting both Party and Government business, drawing from his vast experiences, President Mnangagwa said.

In recognition of his immense contributions to Zimbabwe, both during and after the liberation struggle, the Zanu PF Politburo has conferred upon him the status of National Hero.

On behalf of the Party, Zanu PF, Government, my family, and on my behalf, I wish to express my deepest, heartfelt condolences to the Chigudu Family on this sad loss.

May the family derive comfort from the contribution he made to this Great Nation.

Cde Chigudus hero status means he will be laid to rest at the National Heroes Acre in Harare, where the countrys most distinguished liberation figures are honored.

His passing marks the end of a significant chapter in Zimbabwes history, but his legacy of resilience, patriotism and service will live on.

news.title: US$52k thief jailed 5 years
news.content:
Prosper Dembedza

Herald Correspondent

A Harare man who stole a satchel containing US$52 000 from a Bhola Hardware employee while he was coming out of Harare Street branch has been jailed for 5 years.

Tapiwanashe Murefu (27) was initially sentenced to 15 years in jail before five years were suspended on condition of good behavior, another five years were also set aside on condition that the accused restitutes US$51k to the complainant before October 2025.

The State led by Ms Dzidzai Josiah proved that Murefu teamed up with his accomplices and drove to Bhola Hardware located along Harare Street in three motor vehicles.

On arrival they confronted the complainant who was coming from the shop and grabbed his satchel containing cash amounting to US$52 000 and ran back into their vehicles and immediately sped off.

The complainant later made a report at the ZRP Kopje and investigations were instituted.

Investigations were carried out leading to the arrest of Murefu who then implicated his accomplices.

Murefu led the police to the recovery of USS$1 000 and while his accomplice Tawanda Mutuma led to the recovery of US$500

The accused were allegedly captured on CCTV committing the offence and there were witnesses to testify.

news.title: President leaves for joint SADC – EAC Summit on DRC
President leaves for Tanzania
news.content:
Fungi Kwaramba

News Editor

President Mnangagwa has departed for Tanzania to participate in an extraordinary summit involving regional leaders from SADC (Southern African Development Community) and the East Africa Community (EAC).

The summits primary focus is to address the escalating security crisis in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).

As the SADC Chairperson, President Mnangagwa has underscored Africas commitment to silencing the guns in DRC.

His departure was marked by a send-off at Robert Mugabe International Airport, attended by Vice President Constantino Chiwenga, various Cabinet ministers, and service chiefs.

He was also accompanied by DefenCe Minister Oppah Muchinguri Kashiri.

This summit reflects a collaborative effort by African nations to tackle regional security challenges.

news.title: Streetlights for Donga Business Centre
news.content:
Midlands Bureau

TONGOGARA Rural District Council has installed streetlights at Donga Business Centre to address a rise in crime.

The councils chief executive officer Engineer Tungamirai Chuchuchu said before the installation of the streetlights there had been incidents of mugging at the business centre and in nearby areas.

The 1000 watts lights were installed by Radiation Company on December 22, 2024, and cover a distance of 400 metres from the business centre up to Shurugwi-Mhandamabwe Road, he said.

Engineer Chuchuchu said the RDC is playing an active role in addressing the surge in criminal activity in the area.

A lot should be done to ensure that residents are safe at all times, he said. Council believes that improved lighting will deter criminal activity and create a safer environment for residents and visitors.

Engineer Chuchuchu said the RDC is also embarking on other projects like fencing the council beer hall, with the hope of attracting investors for the growth of the council.

The beer hall is being fenced so that we can rent it out and increase council revenue, he said.

news.title: Five copper cable thieves jailed
news.content:
Crime Reporter

Five copper cable thieves, including one woman, have been arrested and jailed for between 20 and 50 years.

The five are Phillip Chitava (43), Steven Nyakabau (31), Partson Gurupira (28), Clayton Nyakatonje (24) and Mary Ngono (33) of Chinzanga in Motoko.

Criminal Investigations Department spokesperson, Detective Inspector Rachel Muteweri said the five were found in possession of copper windings and cables without the requisite licenses.

From May 2024 to January 2025, the accused persons connived to steal copper windings from transformers and network boosters in and around Mutoko, she said.

The accused persons tripped the transformers and stole copper windings. They were also targeting network boosters and telephone cables.

Due to the prevalence of vandalism in Mutoko, police detectives conducted an operation which resulted in the arrest of the five accused persons. The five were charged with eleven counts, she said.

On January 28, Chitava appeared at Kotwa Magistrates Court where he was convicted and sentenced to an effective 20 years imprisonment.

On February 4, Nyakabau, Gurupira and Nyakatonje appeared before the Kotwa Magistrates Court and were convicted and sentenced to 50 years imprisonment.

However, they will each serve an effective 30 years in prison as the other 20 years will run concurrently with the sentence.

Meanwhile, Ngono is yet to appear in court.

news.title: EMA takes National Clean-Up Campaign to Manhenga, Bindura Rural
news.content:
Fungai Lupande

Mashonaland Central Bureau

The Environmental Management Agency (EMA) has urged business owners at the Manhenga Business Centre to actively participate in the national clean-up campaign.

This call to action was made after it was observed that many people at the business centre were bystanders during the clean-up exercise.

EMAs provincial manager, Mr Robert Rwafa said there is need for the Bindura Rural District Council to take action against irresponsible business owners who are littering the area.

I urge everyone to actively participate in the national clean-up. Let us remind each other that the clean-up campaign is a lifestyle, he said.

It is concerning that officials and visitors are doing the cleaning while residents remain spectators.
